subject: [Hog] Problem 2
content:
Problem 2

Please post all questions you have below concerning Problem 2 in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: Why is it that free_bacon() takes score and not opponent_score? Isn't the function in the body doing an operation to the opponent's score?

follow-ups.feedback: `score` is the opponent's score in this question

threads.question: Any tips/ideas in how I can separate the digits of the score to then be able to use a min operator????

follow-ups.feedback: Make use of the mod (%) operator which gives you the remainder and floor division (//) which gets rid of the decimal.

OK. So i bounded the mod 10 one to a given name, then I bounded the // to another name. This should give me the 2 digits of the number. However, when I use 10 - min(the two names I gave for the mod and //) it doesn't seem to work. Is my logic wrong??
Even I did the 10-min(digit1, digit2) but it doesn't seem to work.

It's giving me this as the output.  Question 2 > Suite 1 > Case 1  >>> from hog import *  >>> take_turn(2, 0, make_test_dice(4, 6, 1))  # Error: expected  # 10  # but got  It isn't showing anything for the but got __ part
The min () thing worked for me. The rest of my code wasn’t right. Keep trying. As a tip you should go back an look over lab 01 (the add digits problem).

threads.question: why free bacon (57) gives 6?  I mean I think it should be 10-5=5 according to the rules.  Thanks!

follow-ups.feedback: Yes. It should give you 5. Where are you getting 6 from free_bacon(57)?
